— a well deserved title. The medieval town centre built around a
is dissected by small canals and streams running out of Lac Annecy, which is clean, fresh and a wonderful azure colour. Annecy is also the prefecture of the département of
Annecy is a popular day trip from nearby
(bring your passport for the border crossing - although checks are not frequent). Buses operated by
leave from Geneva's intercity bus station about 5 times/day on Sundays, more frequently on weekdays. A round-trip ticket costs 32 CHF and the trip takes about an hour/direction.
Geneva is the nearest major international airport and is well served from across Europe and beyond. With the new motorway, it is now just over 35 min away. A little further away is
, which is focused on low cost and winter flights. Both are about a one-hour drive by car or bus. The airport at Annecy only has flights to Paris.
A41 runs next to Annecy, and you can easily drive there from e.g. Geneva, Lyon,

content=A former palace-turned-prison. As the name says, it is situated on an island between the canals.

: A cozy village festival is held, a great place to bring the family. Rides and vendors are abundant, along with the great French cuisine. The festival lines Lac Annecy and is very peaceful and beautiful.
: One of the biggest animation festivals is held in Annecy (6 days)
: Noctibules festival during the nights (4 days)
) with attractions around the lake and a great fireworks. This event brings more than 100 000 spectators.
: "Descente des Alpages" or "Return from Alpine Pastures". Occurs once a year on the second Saturday of October. This is a traditional farmers' festival with local music, food and entertainment.

Annecy has a number of local artisan shops as well as many European chain boutiques.

There is a market (
) each Sunday morning in the pedestrian streets of the medieval city. Le marché is an open air market with the freshest fruits and vegetables.

content=A large shopping centre in the middle of town with a wide variety of stores.

For between meals try the ice cream shops, favored by the locals, located on the numerous pedestrian-only by-ways that weave the city and river together.

value: content=The best hand made ice creams in the city, with more than 40 different tastes.

And of course, Haute-Savoie is famous for its cheese recipes :

value: content=THE restaurant in Annecy for cheese specialities : Fondue, Raclette, ...

Bed & breakfast, youth hostel exist. Surrounding mountains and lake activities are draining a large number of tourist during the summer and more and more during the winter season. Several winter sport resorts are within a 30 minute drive.

value: directions=next to train station in business district, short walk from the Old Town and lake
content=An aparthotel offering studio style apartments for up to 4 people. A fitness room, sauna and private parking are also available.
price=From €22/person/night for a dorm bed and from €55/room/night for a 1-2 person private room
content=A clean hostel located about a 15 minute walk from the train/bus station and a 5 minute walk to the historic area of town. They also have a large patio and a full kitchen.

The town itself gets ridiculously busy in July but September brings less folk - visit then when the air is clearer and the views to the mountains are better.
If you want to get away from the crowds, try the far side of the lake. The best way to get around is by bike.
